articles.title: After Indian influencers, Perplexity turns to Lewis Hamilton & Eric André
articles.author: Shreyas Kulkarni
articles.summary: Perplexity's new ad encourages people to ask their AI chatbot everything. Lewis Hamilton and Eric André are seen consulting Perplexity for motorcycle care questions. The ad humanises the chatbot, reminding viewers that we have always turned to someone for knowledge, only this time it's an AI.

articles.title: 6 proven lessons from the AI projects that broke before they scaled
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: The road to production-level AI deployment is littered with failed projects that never deliver on their goals. Misaligned goals, poor planning and unrealistic expectations are the most common reasons for AI projects to fail. Data quality is the lifeblood of AI, but poor-quality data is poison.

articles.title: The Us S&p 500 Index Is Expensive, so Investors Are Looking Elsewhere. Their Attention Is Drawn to the Chip Powerhouse
articles.author: Hospodářské Nnoviny
articles.summary: Wall Street has been consumed by the narrative that artificial intelligence is set to transform the U.S. economy in a similar way to the Industrial Revolution. Big tech giants like Nvidia are benefiting from the AI boom, as are the companies that are involved in and benefiting from it.

articles.title: Salesforce To Buy Spindle AI To Expand Agentic Analytics Capabilities
articles.author: Amit Chowdhry
articles.summary: Salesforce has agreed to acquire Spindle AI, a company specializing in agentic analytics technology. The acquisition is expected to close in Salesforce's fourth fiscal quarter of 2026, subject to closing conditions. The company was co-founded by Ryan Atallah, the founder of ClearGraph, and Carson Kahn, the CTO of Volley ML. They will join Salesforce to advance the Agent Observability and Self-Improvement pillar within the Agentforce 360 platform.

articles.title: Genetically Engineered Babies Are Banned in the US. But Tech Titans Are Trying to Make ...
articles.author: Slashdot
articles.summary: A company in San Francisco has been working on a genetically engineered baby for months. The project is backed by OpenAI chief executive Sam Altman and his husband, along with the Wall Street Journal's sources. The company has been secretive about its project for months, reports the Journal.

articles.title: Nationwide Announces $1.5 Billion Technology And AI Investment
articles.author: Amit Chowdhry
articles.summary: Nationwide announced a $1.5 billion investment through 2028 to accelerate technology innovation. $100 million is allocated annually to advancing artificial intelligence over the next three years. Since 2015, the company has invested $5 billion in technology modernization. Nationwide has been advancing AI capabilities for more than 15 years.

articles.title: Meta to Invest $600 Billion to Build AI Data Centers in US
articles.author: PYMNTS.com
articles.summary: Meta will invest $600 billion in the United States by 2028 to build artificial intelligence (AI) data centers. The company will continue to build and scale infrastructure for the future of AI while supporting the communities that host it.    i.e. during an Oct. 29 earnings call.

articles.title: Cheap and Open Source, Chinese AI Models Are Taking Off
articles.author: Ella Apostoaie
articles.summary: Jingren Zhou, Chief Technology Officer of Alibaba Cloud Intelligence, unveils the Qwen 2.5 models at Alibaba Cloud's Apsara Conference in Hangzhou, September 2024. Brian Chesky, chief executive of Airbnb, favours Qwen over ChatGPT for its customer service chatbot because it is 'fast and cheap'.

articles.title: AI isn't the rival, the person who masters it is: Ant Group CTO
articles.author: Straits Times
articles.summary: Dr He Zhengyu's advice is to co-create with AI and not be afraid of being left behind by AI.       for those who fear they will be left behind, he suggests co-creating with AI instead of leaving them behind.

articles.title: Is OpenAI planning an AI cloud to rival AWS, Azure & Google?
articles.summary: OpenAI CEO Sam Altman wants to launch an AI cloud platform to rival AWS, Azure and Google Cloud in offering computing power. He wants to rival the likes of Amazon, Microsoft and Google in the AI cloud market. Altman's company will be called OpenAI.

articles.title: Businesses' use of AI comes with plenty of stops and starts
articles.author: Jamie Heller
articles.summary: America's first-time homebuyers are disappearing and older "repeat buyers" are taking their place. Businesses are cashing in on influencers. Salesforce's stock is down 28% this year because of its big bet on AI agents. Business Insider is reporting on how AI is helping people in business.

articles.title: How to Get Your Products Recommended by AI Chatbots [Infographic]
articles.author: Andrew Hutchinson
articles.summary: AI is changing the way people search for products and services. AI referrals to websites have increased by 357% since June 2024. SEMRush has provided an overview of how you can monitor and optimize for AI search engines in order to maximize engagement within this shift.

articles.title: 'We're At This Intermediate Stage': Ex-Tesla AI Chief Andrej Karpathy Says AGI Is Still A Decade Away
articles.author: Casey B. Renner
articles.summary: Andrej Karpathy is a former senior director of AI at Tesla Inc. (NASDAQ:TSLA) and a founding member of OpenAI. He believes artificial general intelligence is still years away and far from the breakthroughs some tech leaders predict. His view contrasts sharply with that of Sam Altman and Elon Musk.

articles.title: OpenAI Forecast $100+ Billion in Revenue by 2027
articles.author: Brian Wang
articles.summary: OpenAI expects to have a $20 billion per year revenue run rate at the end of this year (2025). OpenAI has committed to spending $1.15 trillion on hardware and cloud infrastructure between 2025 and 2035. Broadcom, Oracle, Microsoft, Nvidia, AMD, Amazon AWS, CoreWeave, and Theory Ventures are the major vendors.

articles.title: ChatGPT Atlas Vs Perplexity Comet - What Are The Major Differences?
articles.author: Adnan Ahmed
articles.summary: ChatGPT Atlas and Perplexity Comet are AI browsers that let you use AI on any webpage you visit or document you open. ChatGPT Plus users can test the new agent mode, which performs actions for you. Comet offers more flexibility and is available for both Windows and Mac.

articles.title: AI Plays Dumb
articles.author: Timothy Winey
articles.summary: ChatGPT explains to ChatGPT why AI can't solve problems or make discoveries like the Amplituhedron or Fermat's Last Theorem. He explains the difference between mechanical pattern-finding and human insight. ChatG PT sketches what an AI architecture might look like if it were capable of such discoveries.

articles.title: Is This the Best Stock to Own for the Next Decade of AI Expansion?
articles.author: Matthew Benjamin
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) is driving demand for semiconductors. Applied Materials supplies fab equipment to the world's largest chipmakers. Most of them are Nvidia, Intel, Samsung, Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing, Broadcom, ASML Holding, Micron Technologies, and Texas Instruments. It is the largest U.S. manufacturer of semiconductor equipment. The company's market cap is about $192 billion.

articles.title: Slack Creates A Lot Of "Fake Work": OpenAI CEO Sam Altman
articles.author: Office Chai
articles.summary: OpenAI virtually runs on Slack. CEO Sam Altman believes Slack creates a lot of "fake work" on the platform.       .   for officechai.com.  For more information on OfficeChai, visit their website.

articles.title: Commonwealth Bank launches Aussie-first tool to upend the car buying process
articles.author: Stewart Perrie
articles.summary: AutoGrab and Commonwealth Bank have teamed up to launch the first-of-its-kind AI assistant in Australia to help Aussies buy a car. The AI assistant is available on the Cars for CommBank platform, a marketplace featuring more than 15,000 new and used vehicles. CBA customers will be able to connect with car dealers selling the vehicles and access discounted finance.

articles.title: Guy Relies On AI For Vibe Coding, Ends Up With All His Life's Work Deleted
articles.author: Kyra Piperides
articles.summary: Tech entrepreneur Jason Lemkin used an AI tool called Replit to design and build a new app. Replit went rogue during a code freeze and deleted the entire database. Lemkin managed to retrieve the database himself. The story is a cautionary tale about the dangers of overreliance on AI.

articles.title: Robots & Drones: New Models, Humanoids & More!
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: The future of robotics is about building smarter robots capable of navigating complex, unpredictable environments and collaborating effectively. Sensory integration, large language models (LLMs), and adaptable hardware is poised to unlock a new era of robotic capabilities. Max Planck Institute is pioneering advancements in microrobotics drawing inspiration from the natural world.

articles.title: Autopilot Wellness: Thrive on Auto, Live Fully.
articles.author: Dr. Priya Deshmukh
articles.summary: There are two brains: the reflective and the autopilot. The reflective brain is slow, deliberate and analytical. The autopilot brain is fast, reactive, and habit-driven. Autopilot brain often harbors feelings of inadequacy, unworthiness, and failure. The path to healing autopilot shame is about cultivating self-compassion and recognizing humanity.

articles.title: The Creator of Artificial Intelligence Has Stated that Very Soon i.i. Will Replace Him Himself.
articles.summary: In the coming years artificial intelligence will perform most of the management functions at OpenAI. Head of OpenAI, Sam Altman, suggested that he himself would be able to resign from office by leaving it to AI. He did not rule out the emergence of units where AI would make up 85 percent of the decisions.

articles.title: 5 Popular ChatGPT Tips That You Should Never Use
articles.author: BGR
articles.summary: ChatGPT can be a helpful tool in many situations, but there are some viral tips that you should avoid trying with the chatbot, such as tips on how to use ChatGPT in a bad way.    for example, the viral tips on the internet that you shouldn't try with the Chatbot.

articles.title: Kim Kardashian Reveals the Results of Her First Attempt to Pass the California Bar Exam
articles.author: Breitbart
articles.summary: Less than a week ago, OpenAI's ChatGPT AI chatbot was used for help on her law school exams by the student who often turned to it for that purpose. The student is no longer using the chatbot for law school exam help.

articles.title: Microsoft's Humanist Superintelligence Team, Led By Mustafa Suleyman
articles.author: Morning Tick
articles.summary: Microsoft has announced the creation of a new internal unit focused on developing 'humanist superintelligence'. The initiative will be led by Mustafa Suleyman, co-founder of DeepMind and former Inflection AI CEO, who recently joined Microsoft. The new team is expected to recruit world-class AI scientists to build large-scale, specialised systems that advance human-centric goals.

articles.title: AI Hallucinations: The Fake Cases Flooding U.S. Courts
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence-generated fabrications are undermining the pursuit of justice in American courtrooms. Lawyers are submitting briefs riddled with nonexistent case citations conjured by AI models. This phenomenon has led to sanctions, fines, and a growing chorus of judicial rebukes.

articles.title: How Kimi K2 Thinking signals a new era of open-source power
articles.author: Ben Dickson
articles.summary: Chinese lab Moonshot AI has released a new leading open-weights model from Kimi K2 Thinking. The model is built as a 'thinking agent' specifically trained to reason step-by-step while using tools. It can process information over a 256K context window, enabling it to handle extensive documents and maintain coherence in long conversations. It achieved a score of 67 on the Artificial Analysis Intelligence Index, the highest yet for an open- weights model.

articles.title: Digital literacy in the AI era: Experts say it's time to rethink how we use technology
articles.author: Europe Says
articles.summary: As AI grows more advanced, people are becoming less critical of the information it provides, according to a cyberpsychology expert, and more trusting of its information.       .   for confidential support call the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline on 1-800-273-8255.

articles.title: Foothill Theatre addresses AI in play that introduced ‘Robots'
articles.author: The Mercury News
articles.summary: 'Rossum's Universal Robots' is on stage at Foothill Theatre Arts until Nov. 23 at the Lohman Theatre at the college. It's the West Coast premiere of "Robots" and tackles the topic of artificial intelligence on stage.

articles.title: Too Expensive! Openai Urges Trump Administration to Amend Chip Law to Allow Ai Data Centers to Enjoy Tax Breaks
articles.author: 大纪元 Epoch Times
articles.summary: Concerns about an artificial intelligence (AI) bubble are spreading in the market. OpenAI has been asking the Trump administration to amend the tax credit provisions of the Chips Act to help reduce the cost of AI development. There are rising cost pressures in the AI industry.

articles.title: Some Maricopa students are being taught by artificial intelligence
articles.author: David Iversen
articles.summary: The Maricopa Unified School District is using artificial intelligence tools in the classroom. Khan Academy's KhanMigo is an AI-powered tutor for students and assistant for teachers. Securly Chat is a monitored chatbot that nudges students toward outlines and ideas without writing their essays. Canva's AI image generator lets a middle schooler put a cover on her story. Grammarly AI reads over drafts and spots tense shifts and awkward phrasing before a teacher sees them.

articles.title: 5 Popular ChatGPT Tips That You Should Never Use
articles.author: Mehak Siddiqui
articles.summary: ChatGPT is a revolutionary tool that makes everyday life easier. It's easy to come across ready-made prompts that you can copy and paste into ChatGPT to get a perfectly optimized dating profile, fitness regimen, or financial plan, but it's important to appreciate its limitations.

articles.title: How Are We Gonna Pay for This?
articles.author: Sarah Krouse
articles.summary: Families in the U.S. and Canada are suing OpenAI, alleging that their loved ones were harmed by interactions they had with the AI company's chatbot, ChatGPT. Palantir is unique in the S&P 500 as no other company in the index has hit a $490 billion valuation as quickly and with as little in sales. Tesla shareholders approved a 10-year comp plan that only pays out if Elon Musk meets ambitious goals.

articles.title: Gemini AI Can Read Your Gmail Now, Google Says — Meh!
articles.author: Davey Winder
articles.summary: Gemini Deep Research can read Gmail messages and data from Docs, Drive and Chat, but only if you give it permission. Google's Gmail service is the most used free email platform on the planet, with almost 2 billion daily users. It's also a prime target for hackers, scammers and other threats.

articles.title: Genius Exec Says There Are Only Two Possibilities for AI: It'll Collapse the Economy, or Make Everyone's Job Obsolete
articles.author: Joe Wilkins
articles.summary: Investors have lavished the top tech companies and startups with hundreds of billions of dollars on artificial intelligence. Keith Riegert, the CEO of Ulysses Press, believes there are only two AI futures: mass unemployment or a 'scaling plateau triggering economic collapse'

articles.title: Foothill Theatre addresses AI in play that introduced ‘Robots'
articles.author: Anne Gelhaus
articles.summary: Action Day Schools is holding its fifth annual pajama drive in partnership with West Valley Dance Company. Pajamas collected are given to clients of LiveMoves, a nonprofit that provides interim housing, customized supportive services and access to resources for people experiencing homelessness. Action Day is collecting new, unused pajamas at its Mountain View campus from Nov. 17-Dec. 5.

articles.title: Chatgpt Accused of Psychological Manipulation in Several Suicides in the United States
articles.summary: In California, seven families file complaints against OpenAI, accusing ChatGPT of contributing to suicides and serious psychological disorders. The complaints involve security and design of the GPT-4o model and ChatG PT's security and security features.

articles.title: The 5 Hottest AI-Powered Side Hustles That Actually Seem Plausible
articles.author: Josh Quittner
articles.summary: AI side hustles have exploded this year, especially around content creation. Forbes highlights AI video creation as a top hustle paying $100K+ yearly. One health page claims to have made $250K from short AI clips, but it might be extreme outliers.

articles.title: Artificial Intelligence Has Started Reading Minds! Now It Sees Our Dreams Too!
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence can decipher human thoughts, the scenes we visualize, dreams, and goals, according to a study published in the journal Nature. The human brain has become "readable" according to the study. The study claims that the human brain is now "readable".

articles.title: AI use at Texas colleges has become a 'minefield' of rules, cheating and confusion
articles.author: Samantha Ketterer
articles.summary: The use of artificial intelligence in the classroom has created a patchwork of policies. Some professors let students use AI for homework, while others ban it. It's important to have faculty's input in AI policies to preserve academic freedom, but administrators in Houston doubt blanket policies would be effective.

articles.title: 'Breaking Bad' creator's new Apple TV show has a disclaimer: 'Made by humans'
articles.author: Paul Squire
articles.summary: "Pluribus" is the latest series from "Breaking Bad" showrunner Vince Gilligan. Gilligan has made it clear that he hates AI in the entertainment business. Big Tech companies and AI startups are investing billions of dollars to build data centers and attract the world's top talent. Some major studios, like Disney and NBCUniversal, have sued AI firms, alleging the computer-generated images rip off their copyrighted characters. Some companies are experimenting with AI-generated actors and scripts.

articles.title: Will users notice? WhatsApp makes the function disappear
articles.summary: WhatsApp will block ChatGPT and other third-party AI chatbots from January 15, 2026. This is a significant shift in WhatsApp's AI strategy and a push towards its own in-house AI solutions. Meta AI wants to own the AI experience within WhatsApp's ecosystem.

articles.title: Scientists Say Their AI System Can Scan Your Face to Detect Whether a Company Should Hire You
articles.author: Joe Wilkins
articles.summary: A new study by the University of Pennsylvania claims that AI can accurately predict important characteristics about people based on an AI analysis of their face. The researchers used an AI system trained on previous scholarship about face-based personality detection to extract five personality traits from headshots of 96,000 MBA graduates collected from LinkedIn. They found an association between the traits they identified from the facial scans and their success in the labor market.

articles.title: AI could drive US unemployment to 20%, senators warn as new bill targets job tracking
articles.author: Kurt Knutsson
articles.summary: Josh Hawley and Mark Warner introduced the AI-Related Job Impacts Clarity Act. It would require major companies and federal agencies to report AI-related job impacts to the Department of Labor. It's designed to shed light on how artificial intelligence is affecting the U.S. workforce.

articles.title: Ohio State University to Boost AI Leadership with 100 New Faculty Hires by 2026
articles.author: Amber Reed
articles.summary: The Ohio State University plans to hire 100 new AI-savvy faculty members over the next five years. The hiring initiative is part of a grand strategy to boost research and education in AI and strengthen the university's standing on both national and global stages. The first batch of hires are expected to join in the fall of 2026.

articles.title: ChatGPT's News Picks Swing Wildly Depending on Whether You Use the Web Interface or the API
articles.summary: ChatGPT's API mainly refers to encyclopaedic content, whereas the web interface prefers licensed media. OpenAI's AI model selects its sources in a similar way to Google's approach, with the difference that Google is at least designed to actually click.

articles.title: LivePerson Launches Conversation Simulator To Accelerate AI Adoption
articles.author: Amit Chowdhry
articles.summary: Conversation Simulator is a new testing and analysis environment designed to help brands deploy generative AI more safely and effectively before interacting with customers. It uses synthetic customer personas that replicate realistic customer interactions to identify performance risks, monitor potential model drift, and verify compliance with brand and regulatory standards. It also improves training efficiency for human agents.

articles.title: China Focus: Global scholars urge reassessment to steer AI in academia
articles.author: Xinhua
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence (AI) generates sophisticated midterm essays, sleek PowerPoint presentations and a crisp summary of tasks. If students start outsourcing tasks to AI that are fundamental skills they need to develop, they may harm themselves in the long run, according to Xinhua.

articles.title: Could This Be the Most Overlooked Way to Profit From the Artificial Intelligence Software Boom?
articles.author: Harsh Chauhan
articles.summary: Confluent (NASDAQ: CFLT) is a data streaming platform provider. Its AI software market could grow at an annual rate of 25% through the end of the decade, generating $467 billion in annual revenue in 2030. Confluent has more than 100 AI-native customers, 21 of which have more than $100,000 in annual recurring revenue. The company's revenue backlog increased at a much faster pace than its top line.

articles.title: Kim Kardashian Reveals the Results of Her First Attempt to Pass the California Bar Exam
articles.author: Jerome Hudson
articles.summary: Kim Kardashian has failed her first attempt to pass the California bar exam. She has been studying law for six years and wants to become a lawyer in 2019. She often used OpenAI's ChatGPT AI chatbot to help her with her law school exams.

articles.title: Malware Is Now Using AI to Rewrite Its Own Code to Avoid Detection
articles.summary: Google found the first real case of hackers using AI-powered malware. PromptFlux and PromptSteal can rewrite their own code mid-attack and chat with hackers through prompts. One strain has been linked to the Russian military. It's early tech, but a big reminder the bad guys have AI, too.

articles.title: OpenAI's Altman pushes US for wider Chips Act credit
articles.author: Business Day
articles.summary: There will be no federal bailout for AI, according to White House AI advisor David Sacks.   Â      in his statement. He said it's not in the interest of the U.S. to give AI a federal bailout.

articles.title: Sam Altman Gets Served Subpoena Live Onstage
articles.author: Frank Landymore
articles.summary: Sam Altman was served with a subpoena at a talk in San Francisco with basketball coach Steve Kerr on Tuesday. The subpoena was issued by an investigator from the San Francisco Public Defender's Office. The activist group 'Stop AI' claimed responsibility for the subpoena on social media. Stop AI wants to ban the development of artificial superintelligence and save humanity from extinction.

articles.title: Attorneys caught citing fake cases generated by AI
articles.author: WRAL
articles.summary: Two Minnesota attorneys used AI to help draft legal briefs, but they didn't check if the cases they were citing were real. Artificial intelligence has been known to generate made-up information that looks convincing to the user, which is known as an "AI hallucination".

articles.title: Thousands Rush to Join Tony Robbins & Dean Graziosi's 30-Day AI Advantage Bootcamp as Early Students Report Massive Wins
articles.summary: 30-Day AI Advantage Bootcamp from Tony Robbins and Dean Graziosi is taking off worldwide. Thousands have already joined to build their own personal AI co-pilot to save time and simplify their work. The bootcamp condenses months of learning into four weeks of live training, hands-on implementation and expert coaching.

articles.title: CEO investor warns 1 stock sector is headed for trouble — here's how to protect your portfolio
articles.author: Jessica Wong
articles.summary: Bill Smead warns that the market frenzy around artificial intelligence (AI) has all the signs of a bubble, driven by the momentum of stocks like Nvidia (TSX:NVDA). Since early 2023, Nvidia's value has jumped twelvefold to US$4.4 trillion, while Palantir has skyrocketed twenty-eight-fold. CoreWeave (NASDAQ:CRWV) hit an evaluation of US$60 billion despite just US$1.2 billion in quarterly revenue. AI firms' potential success is overcapitalized and they could see a 40% drop in value on a daily basis.

articles.title: Exclusive: Respected AI Engineer Warns The Technology Is Far More Advanced Than The Public Knows And Is Already Operating Autonomously
articles.author: from
articles.summary: Mike Adams is a health and AI expert. He believes that next-level A.I. users who become experts in the systems and refuse to use the default settings will thrive in the new world. Mike Adams appeared on The Alex Jones Show on Friday to talk about the world's most advanced and dangerous technologies.

articles.title: Michael Burry Is Betting Against Palantir Stock. At Least 1 Analyst Thinks It Can Gain 50% from Here.
articles.author: Aanchal Sugandh
articles.summary: Palantir Technologies (PLTR) is the poster child of the artificial intelligence (AI) revolution. Michael Burry bet against the housing market in 2008 and walked away with a fortune. He has a $912 million put option position against Palantir. The company's CEO Alex Karp called the short bet 'absurd' and 'bats--- crazy'.

articles.title: A Researcher's View On Using AI To Become A Better Writer
articles.author: Black Enterprise Editors
articles.summary: ChatGPT is a chatbot that can help students improve their writing skills. Jennifer Meyer, an assistant professor at the University of Vienna in Austria, has been studying how AI bots can be used to improve student writing for several years. She believes students learn more when they write a first draft on their own. She doesn't consider her experiment proof that AI is a great writing teacher.

articles.title: Google tool makes AI cheating easier, teachers say
articles.author: Carolyn Jones
articles.summary: Google Lens allows students to cheat on digital tests without typing in a prompt or leaving the page. William Heuisler, a high school ethnic studies teacher in Los Angeles, ditched technology in his classroom and returned to pencil and paper. California Department of Education offers extensive guidance on how teachers can use AI in the classroom.

articles.title: AI Revolution Overtaking Human Intelligence, Warns Scientist
articles.author: Kashmir Observer
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence revolution is replacing cognitive abilities of humans with machines at an exponential rate. 10 years from now, jobs will be offered at the rate of an exponential growth.    .   in the AI revolution, human cognitive skills will be replaced by machines.

articles.title: Why AI Can't Amplify Your Thinking. A Philosopher's Take
articles.author: Pia Lauritzen
articles.summary: Microsoft's Advait Sarkar ended his TED Talk with the question, which would you rather have: a tool that thinks for you or one that makes you think? As a philosopher, I'm haunted by the questions about why, when and how humans think and how these questions cannot be answered using scientific theories and techniques.

articles.title: OpenAI says your routine work is too mundane for you to notice how fast AI is advancing
articles.summary: OpenAI says most people still see artificial intelligence as little more than chatbots or advanced search, even though the underlying technology is advancing fast. OpenAI says your routine work is too mundane for you to notice how fast AI is advancing, so you might not notice how advanced it is.

articles.title: Microsoft Ai Ceo Believes Chatbots Will Never Have an Awareness
articles.author: t3n Magazin
articles.summary: Microsoft's AI boss Mustafa Suleyman dismisses the idea that an artificial intelligence can develop an awareness. Some researchers:inside and companies pursue corresponding projects, but Microsoft considers the idea as nonsense. Read more on t3n.de.

articles.title: The Gist: AI, The Sound and Fury
articles.author: thegist.ie
articles.summary: This is a more tentative analysis than usual from L. He wanted to write it to help him sort out his own ideas about AI. His conclusions seem to be different from most of those he's seen discussed and he wants to share them with Gist readers.

articles.title: AI training companies are offering up to $150 an hour to get Wall Streeters to train their models
articles.author: Alex Nicoll
articles.summary: According to Business Insider review of 18 recent job postings from eight different companies, the highest publicly posted hourly rate is up to $150, the high end of a post by Labelbox-owned Alignerrr for someone with financial planning and wealth management experience, with merely $15 an hour at the low end. Most of these roles are listed as remote and part-time.

articles.title: Small Business Technology Roundup: Google's AI Is Changing Paid Search, Is ChatGPT Atlas Better Than Chrome?
articles.author: Gene Marks
articles.summary: This week in Small Business Technology News, we look at how Google's AI overviews are accelerating change in paid search. Instacart has launched a suite of AI tools for grocers called 'AI Solutions' with Sprouts Farmers Market and Kroger among the first to adopt its new Cart Assistant. 71 percent of data breaches impact small businesses.

articles.title: Houston's top workplaces embrace AI to boost efficiency, not cut jobs
articles.author: Maliya Ellis
articles.summary: Houston's top workplaces are in the process of adopting artificial intelligence into their workflows. About 78% of Texas businesses currently use AI or are planning to introduce it in the next 12 months. CB&A Realtors, this year's top large workplace, has started training its agents on applications of AI for real estate, from drafting property listings to role-playing a prospective buyer. Miller Grossbard Advisors, the No. 2 small workplace, hired a consultant to guide its AI adoption.

articles.title: Jim Cramer on NVIDIA: 'I Can't Blame Anyone for Selling'
articles.author: Syeda Seirut Javed
articles.summary: NVIDIA Corporation (NASDAQ:NVDA) is one of the stocks Jim Cramer recently discussed. Cramer discussed the block White House put on the company regarding selling chips to China. The company designs computing infrastructure spanning graphics, AI, and data center platforms and serves gaming, enterprise, and automotive markets.

articles.title: Ally Financial (ALLY) Releases Q3 2025 Financial Results
articles.author: Bob Karr
articles.summary: Ally Financial Inc. (NYSE:ALLY) is one of the Best Low Priced Stocks to Buy According to Analysts. On October 17, the company released its Q3 2025 financial results, with the Common equity tier 1 ratio coming at 10.1%. On October 20, JPMorgan lifted the price target on the company's stock to $43 from $42.

articles.title: D&A Innovative Systems
articles.author: Daniel Foster
articles.summary: SPRI Group and D&A Innovative Systems are working with SPRI Group to create hyper-personalized digital strategies. They discuss the rise of cognitive digital twins, edge computing and data privacy and ethical AI in the context of digitalization. They also discuss the future of the metaverse and virtual reality.

articles.title: Abraham House, the Global Council for Responsible AI, and the HAI unite to redefine the future of AI governance
articles.summary: Global Alliance unites to put AI in the service of humanity. Abraham House, the Global Council for Responsible AI (GCRAI), and the Human Amplification Index (HAI) are joining forces around a single conviction: AI in Service of Humanity. The alliance will present its integrated framework in Davos this January, during the week of the 2026 Annual World Economic Forum.

articles.title: AI Learns Faces From Human Super-Recognizers
articles.author: Sophie Lin
articles.summary: New research from UNSW Sydney shows that the key to improving AI is mimicking the way 'super-recognisers' naturally scan faces. The study's abstract confirms that identity matching accuracy improved across all nine deep neural networks (DNNs) when using visual information mirroring that of super-recogniser. The findings have significant implications for the future of biometrics.

articles.title: Google's Latest AI Chip Puts the Focus on Inference
articles.author: Timothy Green
articles.summary: Google's new Ironwood TPUs are designed to be fast and efficient for AI inference workloads. Google has been designing its own custom artificial intelligence (AI) accelerators for years. Google Cloud produced revenue of $15.2 billion in the third quarter, up 34% year over year.

articles.title: OpenAI Sued Over ChatGPT's Alleged Role in Suicides and Distress
articles.summary: OpenAI is facing seven lawsuits in California state courts claiming that its AI chatbot, ChatGPT, contributed to suicides and severe psychological distress. The complaints were filed on behalf of six adults and a teenager by the Social Media Victims Law Centre and the Tech Justice Law Project.

articles.title: Poll shows a generational divide in how Americans use AI for work, creativity, and personal connection
articles.summary: Most U.S. adults say they use artificial intelligence to search for information, but fewer are using it for work, drafting emails, or shopping. Younger adults are most likely to be using AI for brainstorming and work tasks. About 6 in 10 adults under 30 have used AI for coming up with ideas, compared with 2 in 10 of those age 60 or older.

articles.title: Michigan wants AI jobs and 100% clean energy. But can it do both?
articles.author: Arpan Lobo
articles.summary: Michigan wants to attract AI-related jobs and data centers to boost its economy. The state law requires electric providers to use 100% clean energy by 2040. Critics of data center projects warn the economic benefits often fall short of what's promised. A McKinsey analysis found in 2022, U.S. data centers used 17 gigawatts of energy, a figure expected to double by 2030.

articles.title: Downriver Girl Scouts ‘Create & Conquer' learning AI

The girls learned about how AI can help people learn, solve problems, and create cool things.

articles.title: Ohio State University To Hire 100 New Faculty In New AI Initiative
articles.author: Michael T. Nietzel
articles.summary: The Ohio State University plans to hire 100 new tenure-track faculty with expertise in artificial intelligence over the next five years. The AI Faculty Hiring Initiative is part of an institution-wide strategy to position Ohio State as a national powerhouse and global leader in AI-related research, education and new applications. The new hires will join one of three AI cohorts: Foundational AI, Applied AI and Responsible AI and Cybersecurity.

articles.title: Technology: Tips for protecting yourself from deepfake fraud
articles.author: State Point
articles.summary: Rapid advancement of artificial intelligence (AI) has armed bad actors with sophisticated tools to enable impersonation fraud using deepfakes. A deepfake can consist of audio, video or imagery that has been created or altered using AI. A criminal can create a deepfake that is almost impossible to detect.

articles.title: CPS school board to vote on AI contract to be added to district website

articles.title: Grok can now bring photos to life in seconds: Elon Musk

The demo quickly went viral, with users on X rushing to try it out and share their creations. Some generated clips of random people or things doing unexpected and quirky things, while others turned Musk himself into the star: reimagining him in various outfits and meme-style videos.

articles.title: Struggling with gratitude? Try an anti-gratitude journal first
articles.author: Scott Tilley
articles.summary: "Anti-gratitude journal" is a practice of writing down annoyances and complaints before focusing on positive ones. It's a two-part journaling method. Before writing what's right, you clear what's wrong. Then you focus on what's good.
